description.text: Stepper is responsible for the logic that drives a stepped workflow, it provides a wizard-like workflow by dividing content into logical steps.
Stepper is responsible for the logic that drives a stepped workflow, it provides a wizard-like workflow by dividing content into logical steps.

Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values. Sliders reflect a range of values along a bar, from which users may select a single value. They are ideal for adjusting settings such as volume, brightness, or applying image filters.

Stepper is responsible for the logic that drives a stepped workflow, it provides a wizard-like workflow by dividing content into logical steps.

Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values. Sliders reflect a range of values along a bar, from which users may select a single value. They are ideal for adjusting settings such as volume, brightness, or applying image filters.
Radio group allows user to select one option from a set of options. Use value on group to set the selected option.
Lists are a continuous group of text or images. They are composed of items containing primary and supplemental actions, which are represented by icons and text.
Switches allow users to turn an individual option on or off. They are usually used to activate or deactivate a specific setting.

Switches allow users to turn an individual option on or off. They are usually used to activate or deactivate a specific setting.
Buttons make common actions more obvious and help users more easily perform them. Buttons use labels and sometimes icons to communicate the action that will occur when the user touches them.
